Class Dealer.Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dealer.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    Dealer

    private class Dealer.Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Player class implements the Runnable interface so that it may be executed upon Socket connection in Dealer.execute(). It's initialized with connections to the server (Dealer), and executes with logic further detailed in run(). It holds methods to deliver messages to the connected Client, and receive button choices from getHit().
    See Also:
    Runnable, Socket, Dealer.execute(), Dealer, Client, run()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        private Player(java.net.Socket socket,
               java.lang.String name)
        The player constructor creates Scanner and Formatter objects for Socket interactions with the Client. It then assigns itself the needed player names for reference during execution.
        Parameters:
        socket - Socket object to hold a connection to the server
        name - player name to reference during execution

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The run() method that is executed during thread launch, sends the needed messages to the Client for interpretation. It is reliant on the Dealer.isGameOver() function to continue, and awaits for Dealer.Player objects to be connected, as well as closes the connections when the game ends.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        See Also:
        Dealer.isGameOver(), Client, Dealer.Player

      • sendMessage

        private void sendMessage(java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String message)
        Send message uses the Formatter object created in #Player(Socket, String) to send messages to connected Client.
        Parameters:
        type - a prefix to the message to represent the type of following message
        message - contents of message type "type" to be interpreted by the client.
        See Also:
        #Player(Socket, String)

      • sendMessage

        private void sendMessage(java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String[] messages)
        An alternative to sendMessage(String, String) that handles the same, except can deliver an array of messages instead of one string.
        Parameters:
        type - a prefix to the message to represent the type of following messages for the client
        messages - a set of messages to be delivered following the prefix

      • getHit

        private boolean getHit()
        Utilizes the Scanner object created earlier to get input from the Client on if they would like to "hit" or "stay" on their active turn.
        Returns:
        true if the player would like to "hit" or false otherwise.

      • setSuspended

        private void setSuspended(boolean status)
        a lock safety as advised to use, so that the Player object knows if the dealer has suspended it upon being signaled.
        Parameters:
        status - saftey for permission of player to operate
